page.title: 08RHYMNEY CHAPELS-RELIGION
page.content: Religion has always been an integral part of Welsh life,and if one walks around the town of Rhymney today quite a lot of evidence to this effect will be seen.Basically religion can be divided into two main sections:Non- Conformist and Catholic.The Catholic Church embraces both Roman and Church in Wales. Although today perhaps only 15%-20% of the population regularly attend a place of worship, there is still a considerable religious influence in the area.Services are conducted in both English and Welsh, although it is true to suggest that sermons in Welsh are understood only by a small percentage of the population. As in all Welsh communities chapel and church membership is dwindling and the financial burden, faced by such establishments, increases yearly.
